Interview

<span key="a4660abf69e74c44a03e1582ecf465eb"><span offset-key="a4660abf69e74c44a03e1582ecf465eb:0">Checklist: Preparing for Your Interview Labs Interview Prep Checklist Here's how to prepare in the days before your interview:</span></span>

<span key="68bdf402aa1e4cd6aef458de3fc66570"><span offset-key="68bdf402aa1e4cd6aef458de3fc66570:0">☐ Use your pull request videos as an opportunity to practice walking through a project. Incorporate feedback from your Release Manager and keep iterating (trying again)!</span></span>

<span key="f1bb60f26b834b5a99882657f775089b"><span offset-key="f1bb60f26b834b5a99882657f775089b:0">☐ Practice describing your project to someone who has never seen it.</span></span>

<span key="ac22ecdf4c01467898bee00cd0a18523"><span offset-key="ac22ecdf4c01467898bee00cd0a18523:0">What is it? Why was it built? How does it work? ☐ Practice describing relevant technologies to someone unfamiliar with the technology.</span></span>

<span key="18b7ac45d1d54cbebf99d374b418fc86"><span offset-key="18b7ac45d1d54cbebf99d374b418fc86:0">What is Redux? Why do you use it? What do you like about it? Why is it the best choice for this project? ☐ For extra practice, try using Pramp for mock interviews with peers!</span></span>

<span key="45f1807dc55047669ddc6b7fd92f8d42"><span offset-key="45f1807dc55047669ddc6b7fd92f8d42:0">Pramp instructions:</span></span>

<span key="ae6764c3dd784fbf9f2b48832b3589eb"><span offset-key="ae6764c3dd784fbf9f2b48832b3589eb:0">Step 1: Set up account in Pramp (Links to an external site.)</span></span>

<span key="5ab8af0e1c584c67940a53e7649d1aa6"><span offset-key="5ab8af0e1c584c67940a53e7649d1aa6:0">Step 2: Select the type of interview you want to prep for</span></span>

<span key="17803d49bc214c6c881dc619d0813ecc"><span offset-key="17803d49bc214c6c881dc619d0813ecc:0">Step 3: Schedule mock interviews with an anonymous peer, or invite a Lambda buddy to interview with using the “invite session” feature. We highly recommend scheduling any Pramp mock interviews on separate days so you have time to reflect and improve in between.</span></span>

<span key="ba1ee863733b407b9bae4bd6225661ae"><span offset-key="ba1ee863733b407b9bae4bd6225661ae:0">Once you've completed this checklist, mark this page as "done" below.</span></span>

<span key="f63bff6eff1a47aa97d7efc8690cf8f4"><span offset-key="f63bff6eff1a47aa97d7efc8690cf8f4:0">Bonus: Zero-Hour Checklist Follow these steps leading up to the interview itself to set yourself up for success! 🚀</span></span>

<span key="49f54ab391ea4e919ad078f30c13774e"><span offset-key="49f54ab391ea4e919ad078f30c13774e:0">As early as possible ☐ Make sure you have your 1️⃣ Tell me about yourself ready to go.</span></span>

<span key="7ec1cf10025848a68ff63f1bc8e68228"><span offset-key="7ec1cf10025848a68ff63f1bc8e68228:0">30 minutes before interview ☐ Set up a quiet place to do the interview</span></span>

<span key="7a7562fee5e846bca7b283280d02be81"><span offset-key="7a7562fee5e846bca7b283280d02be81:0">☐ Make sure that you are in a spot with good lighting, a clean background (and one where no one can walk through the background!)</span></span>

<span key="ea63d98e35794ca0bc147f05f8c20845"><span offset-key="ea63d98e35794ca0bc147f05f8c20845:0">☐ Wear the same outfit you would wear if the interview was in person</span></span>

<span key="daeb32d3a2f147c89252fcf7004aae6e"><span offset-key="daeb32d3a2f147c89252fcf7004aae6e:0">☐ Have a notebook/note-taking method of choice ready</span></span>

<span key="de6f3158685b4a51ae961991931bfaaf"><span offset-key="de6f3158685b4a51ae961991931bfaaf:0">☐ Water🚰 beside you! Staying hydrated during stressful situations is key!</span></span>

<span key="614e49590dc34474918d8e809d0ec929"><span offset-key="614e49590dc34474918d8e809d0ec929:0">15 minutes before interview ☐ Be ready and in position for the interview</span></span>

<span key="8068947b0daf4efc8ed25f62b548cb57"><span offset-key="8068947b0daf4efc8ed25f62b548cb57:0">5 minutes before interview ☐ Remind yourself how awesome you are. Really. Say it out loud if possible.</span></span>

<span key="89314833b8c4418a95dc41b69a2c2b58"><span offset-key="89314833b8c4418a95dc41b69a2c2b58:0">☐ Practice your favorite relaxation/grounding practice. This could be doodling, deep breathing, or listening to a favorite pump-up song. You want to make sure that you are well-positioned to put a centered and positive foot forward from the first "hello!"</span></span>

<span key="40d79d2286e3486e8ee99b998b2b0bc3"><span offset-key="40d79d2286e3486e8ee99b998b2b0bc3:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="05456cfef4b042fbaa1ba3b10bcb7d75"><span offset-key="05456cfef4b042fbaa1ba3b10bcb7d75:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="08239eddacd543788704f75cd88b5779"><span offset-key="08239eddacd543788704f75cd88b5779:0">Find all the pairs of two integers in an unsorted array that sum up to a given S.</span></span>

# 

<span key="be149085267e445e886483112b3191f2"><span offset-key="be149085267e445e886483112b3191f2:0">For example, if the array is \[3, 5, 2, -4, 8, 11\] and the sum is 7, your program should return \[\[11, -4\], \[2, 5\]\]</span></span>

# 

<span key="308e1e5db8f440a7b772b0eb95961722"><span offset-key="308e1e5db8f440a7b772b0eb95961722:0">because 11 + -4 = 7 and 2 + 5 = 7.</span></span>

# 

<span key="fcc71e92ff6747758530c770bfde8a4a"><span offset-key="fcc71e92ff6747758530c770bfde8a4a:0">array = \[3, 5, 2, -4, 8, 11\]</span></span>

<span key="4a555aa1caeb4f3a8c0f6840dfa03209"><span offset-key="4a555aa1caeb4f3a8c0f6840dfa03209:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="4f3bdaf587d14a03a5c1cd493b3c43eb"><span offset-key="4f3bdaf587d14a03a5c1cd493b3c43eb:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="7dcd88bf61b2407dbbaeb458bab02a3e"><span offset-key="7dcd88bf61b2407dbbaeb458bab02a3e:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="ff8eb4d9ef2645dbb805ceb38f1c386c">**Understanding the problem**</span>

<span key="ca97bfe573ac44c481fc4b1012d67ede">**Problem Description:** <span offset-key="ca97bfe573ac44c481fc4b1012d67ede:1">Given an array of n integers and given a number K, determines whether there is a pair of elements in the array that sums to exactly K.</span></span>

<span key="e256fda882b1414ba0fe6fcc2395ca1c">**For example :**</span>

<span key="4f8b9ae894e94ec081fed64a876f9ca0"><span offset-key="4f8b9ae894e94ec081fed64a876f9ca0:0">Input : A\[\] = \[-5, 1, -40, 20, 6, 8, 7 \], K=15</span></span>

<span key="9f33bb2bdd7844c39a56ea039282effe"><span offset-key="9f33bb2bdd7844c39a56ea039282effe:0">Output: true ( 7, 8 and -5, 20 are the pairs with sum 15)</span></span>

<span key="66fe17ae25c04ae6a6ba1dd7f11405b5"><span offset-key="66fe17ae25c04ae6a6ba1dd7f11405b5:0">Input : A\[\] = \[-5, 4, -2, 16, 8, 9\], K=15</span></span>

<span key="50d6ecfb6ccc4da98dbb7bf7ed349c88"><span offset-key="50d6ecfb6ccc4da98dbb7bf7ed349c88:0">Output: false (There is no pair of elements whose sum is equal to 15)</span></span>

<span key="063ae20c1a384d9e93f82947947a57f2">**Possible follow-up questions to ask the interviewer :**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="2b053c38536e453b951517928bf8a63f"><span offset-key="2b053c38536e453b951517928bf8a63f:0">Do we know something about the range of the numbers in the array? </span>**Ans:**<span offset-key="2b053c38536e453b951517928bf8a63f:2"> No, they can be arbitrary integers.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="d5bdfdedb1c34533817ff2e34158aadc"><span offset-key="d5bdfdedb1c34533817ff2e34158aadc:0">Are the array elements necessarily positive? </span>**Ans:**<span offset-key="d5bdfdedb1c34533817ff2e34158aadc:2"> No, they can be positive, negative, or zero.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="0326f5e3ed0743fe85ea048382d6de8b"><span offset-key="0326f5e3ed0743fe85ea048382d6de8b:0">Do we know anything about the value of K relative to the numbers in the array? </span>**Ans:**<span offset-key="0326f5e3ed0743fe85ea048382d6de8b:2"> No, it can be arbitrary.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="aa09e6ad61c240ea899bc9300826412e"><span offset-key="aa09e6ad61c240ea899bc9300826412e:0">Can we consider pairs of an element and itself? </span>**Ans:**<span offset-key="aa09e6ad61c240ea899bc9300826412e:2"> No, the pair should consist of two different array elements.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="edaa3da19960437f9e9faa27edb7d180"><span offset-key="edaa3da19960437f9e9faa27edb7d180:0">Can the array contain duplicates? </span>**Ans:**<span offset-key="edaa3da19960437f9e9faa27edb7d180:2"> Sure, that's a possibility.</span></span>

<span key="d8029b431b7549e39cca28542e63f0ec">**Designing efficient solutions**</span>

<span key="ab4178be864b40b7a942412d70ce1927"><span offset-key="ab4178be864b40b7a942412d70ce1927:0">We are discussing four ways to solve this problem :</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="e02ed0a4a1cd4e149a2a4e4849d4071c"><span offset-key="e02ed0a4a1cd4e149a2a4e4849d4071c:0">Brute force Approach: Using two loops</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="26fb6c20bb33463988ebd9bea4be3b9a"><span offset-key="26fb6c20bb33463988ebd9bea4be3b9a:0">Sorting and binary search</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="0fde56dd04d14c5dae34dea1f4f60eb4"><span offset-key="0fde56dd04d14c5dae34dea1f4f60eb4:0">Sorting and two Pointer approach</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="9e61e00a4d014e3aa68eda10aa46044f"><span offset-key="9e61e00a4d014e3aa68eda10aa46044f:0">Using a Hash Table</span></span>

<span key="c17764457a4c43bd9002765c5f5af61a">**1. Brute Force Approach: Using two loops**</span>

<span key="185ed368ac424135be16191d66caf765"><span offset-key="185ed368ac424135be16191d66caf765:0">Use two loops and check A\[i\] + A\[j\] == K for each pair (i, j) in A\[\]. If there exists a pair with sum equals to K then return true. By end of both loops, If you didn’t find such a pair then return false.</span></span>

> <span key="072bd46b10894634a21d21ca9366c596">**Pseudo Code**</span>

1

<span key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a"><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:0">int</span><span offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:1"> find\_sumPair </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:2">(</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:3">A</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:4">\[\],</span><span offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:5"> n</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:6">,</span><span offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:7"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:8">K</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5dd864f094c64893b846f28e8dfffe9a:9">)</span></span>

2

<span key="e81b821ef95d4ed59dac323872fc6bd6"><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="e81b821ef95d4ed59dac323872fc6bd6:0">{</span></span>

3

<span key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797"><span offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:0"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:1">for</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:2">(</span><span offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:3"> i </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:4">=</span><span offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:5"> </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:6">0</span><span offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:7"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:8">to</span><span offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:9"> </span><span class="r-17tb59b" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:10">n</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:11">-</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:12">1</span><span offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:13"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="41eb50297ed24672b7d415effb861797:14">)</span></span>

<span key="bdaa47f15afc4604bac9c365a4cd73eb"><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="bdaa47f15afc4604bac9c365a4cd73eb:0">return</span><span offset-key="bdaa47f15afc4604bac9c365a4cd73eb:1"> </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="bdaa47f15afc4604bac9c365a4cd73eb:2">-</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="bdaa47f15afc4604bac9c365a4cd73eb:3">1</span></span>

12

<span key="00545bfed8f14802b50b6dc31828dab7"><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="00545bfed8f14802b50b6dc31828dab7:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

> <span key="23e983d5fa7c471cb7aeba8c4199925f">**Complexity Analysis**</span>

<span key="28481975e84a4182804bb82c6687103f"><span offset-key="28481975e84a4182804bb82c6687103f:0">The total no. of comparison in worst case = Total no. of possible pairs = nC2 = n(n-1)/2 = O(n²)</span></span>

<span key="23fd54d8cd1246f5b44e83d3af66ddad"><span offset-key="23fd54d8cd1246f5b44e83d3af66ddad:0">Time Complexity = O(n²) and Space Complexity = O(1). Can we improve the time complexity? Let's try to think about it.</span></span>

<span key="ab62d34e2583452eb6edd129249d53ed">**2. Sorting and Binary Search**</span>

<span key="f1272e16bfbb4d0393640e39ea61eef8"><span offset-key="f1272e16bfbb4d0393640e39ea61eef8:0">The idea of binary search works perfectly in the case of the sorted array. We can sort the A\[\] and for each value A\[i\], search whether there is another value K-A\[i\] present in the array or not. Binary search performs searching in O(logn) which could help us to improve the time complexity.</span></span>

> <span key="e452807463f949a8ba078bfe449049a7">**Solution Steps**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="311d12f1f7d7475fbd26f67d359162b0"><span offset-key="311d12f1f7d7475fbd26f67d359162b0:0">Sort the array A\[\] in increasing order</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="63b7127fe21c4f6e99fca6276f704670"><span offset-key="63b7127fe21c4f6e99fca6276f704670:0">For each element A\[i\], use binary search to look for K-A\[i\].</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d3ec13313e864304989961f50981964b"><span offset-key="d3ec13313e864304989961f50981964b:0">If there exists a value K-A\[i\] in the array A, then return true.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8e211ac807fc48fdad0d764b35758d73"><span offset-key="8e211ac807fc48fdad0d764b35758d73:0">If you didn’t find such a pair in the whole array , then return false.</span></span>

> <span key="8959099603e3446594795a5d9d37d49f">**Complexity Analysis**</span>

<span key="2e2b5b9fc74f4ed980cc0b01b5987abf"><span offset-key="2e2b5b9fc74f4ed980cc0b01b5987abf:0">Suppose we are using heap sort/merge sort and iterative binary search for the implementation.</span></span>

<span key="63eca79e54fc4003bd41935914090521"><span offset-key="63eca79e54fc4003bd41935914090521:0">Time Complexity = Time complexity of sorting + n. Time complexity of Binary Search = O(nlogn) + n. O(logn) = O(nlogn)</span></span>

<span key="e474a574d0f44756bb90b06470640830"><span offset-key="e474a574d0f44756bb90b06470640830:0">Space Complexity = Space Complexity of sorting + Space complexity of the binary search (Iterative Implementation)</span></span>

<span key="5dc71cd3470c42edae7d1df8df4533e5"><span offset-key="5dc71cd3470c42edae7d1df8df4533e5:0">If merge sort ,Space Complexity = O(n) + O(1) = O(n)</span></span>

<span key="e59bf58a1b8b4aed80520d646f156267"><span offset-key="e59bf58a1b8b4aed80520d646f156267:0">If Heap Sort, Space Complexity = O(1) + O(1) = O(1)</span></span>

> <span key="3e58e0995d18477bb2a8fe3248f5b015">**Critical Ideas to think!**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="787d0d0c451444f9b66d688a83a4bc0e"><span offset-key="787d0d0c451444f9b66d688a83a4bc0e:0">What would be the time and space complexity if we use quicksort? Compare different sorting algorithms</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a935404da62542d99d0013a6ca6466a4"><span offset-key="a935404da62542d99d0013a6ca6466a4:0">What would be the space complexity of the recursive binary search?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="755401922c444dd98105d9d7540a9c0a"><span offset-key="755401922c444dd98105d9d7540a9c0a:0">Why are we searching K - A\[i\] for each element in array A\[\]?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="794e5b2dc4934e1480986e485acca7ec"><span offset-key="794e5b2dc4934e1480986e485acca7ec:0">Prepare a list of problems where you can apply the idea of sorting and binary search.</span></span>

<span key="946c1bfb5066403c9170f8d6c7025cf2">**3. Sorting and two Pointer approach**</span>

<span key="fa2e6af903a24cf68d856d65a8db03c2"><span offset-key="fa2e6af903a24cf68d856d65a8db03c2:0">Sort the array A\[\] then walk two pointers inward from the ends of the array, at each point looking at their sum. If it is exactly k, then we are done. If it exceeds k, then any sum using the larger element is too large, so we walk that pointer inwards. If it is less than k, then any sum using the lower element is too small, so we walk that pointer inwards.</span></span>

> <span key="7b5d61b2b39b4946bb2dc137e3c2b2a0">**Solution Steps**</span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="c5ad7fb2b0ad4aab874cdcfcee0fe4c5"><span offset-key="c5ad7fb2b0ad4aab874cdcfcee0fe4c5:0">Sort the array A\[\] in increasing order</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="9330f5918b6c4a3b916958c488244bce"><span offset-key="9330f5918b6c4a3b916958c488244bce:0">Initialize two index variables in the sorted array A\[\].</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1fac2f4f1a3a47abad96eefaeac2ca13"><span offset-key="1fac2f4f1a3a47abad96eefaeac2ca13:0">left pointer: i = 0</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="21045da900f647eb96748347413afd0d"><span offset-key="21045da900f647eb96748347413afd0d:0">right pointer : j = n-1</span></span>

<span key="d197ba635fbc484db8f8df4b6268d674"><span offset-key="d197ba635fbc484db8f8df4b6268d674:0">3) Run a loop while i&lt; j.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="bcc3d31725794b069ae463987587755d"><span offset-key="bcc3d31725794b069ae463987587755d:0">If (A\[i\] + A\[j\] == K) then return true</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9d4750a05838415fa47c8f3164a981a0"><span offset-key="9d4750a05838415fa47c8f3164a981a0:0">if( A\[i\] + A\[j\] &lt; K) then increment i by 1</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2c0fa430b8674678af470eba76e0b33f"><span offset-key="2c0fa430b8674678af470eba76e0b33f:0">if( A\[i\] + A\[j\] > K) then decrement j by 1</span></span>

<span key="43cc4687149645c2a76f35c87045831c"><span offset-key="43cc4687149645c2a76f35c87045831c:0">4) If didn’t find such a pair in the whole array - return false.</span></span>

> <span key="75d2be8d29f949ca9a0ee3aff3d8abaf">**Complexity Analysis**</span>

<span key="9aca45986ad04a67bca8be01fdc031a7"><span offset-key="9aca45986ad04a67bca8be01fdc031a7:0">Suppose we are using Heap Sort or merge sort.</span></span>

<span key="b26d340484cb4b3b83168c04f2b65348"><span offset-key="b26d340484cb4b3b83168c04f2b65348:0">Time Complexity = Time complexity of sorting + Time complexity of two pointer approach (while loop) = O (n log n) + O(n) = O (n log n)</span></span>

<span key="9f249204bdf54229a1fbda1b217fdd48"><span offset-key="9f249204bdf54229a1fbda1b217fdd48:0">If merge sort, Space Complexity = O(n)</span></span>

<span key="570a0d41fe62489883808be072de52b4"><span offset-key="570a0d41fe62489883808be072de52b4:0">If Heap Sort, Space Complexity = O(1)</span></span>

> <span key="6f80bb310c674de498c7506ee8c05b52">**Critical Ideas to think!**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="29884faa27624008bee9029c7110b311"><span offset-key="29884faa27624008bee9029c7110b311:0">is this algorithm works fine if elements are repeated?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5211b7e33fc8424b84f505ee5c277cc5"><span offset-key="5211b7e33fc8424b84f505ee5c277cc5:0">The time complexity of while loop is O(n) in the worst-case - why?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4369d80533304ac49ec07f09bb184b06"><span offset-key="4369d80533304ac49ec07f09bb184b06:0">Why the idea of the two pointer approach works perfectly for a sorted array?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="67cd704fdae7499a99956c192aa7aaac"><span offset-key="67cd704fdae7499a99956c192aa7aaac:0">Prepare a list of problems where you can apply the idea of two pointer approach for the solution.</span></span>

<span key="86e6be7f94a34a9e9d56fc351949f483"><span offset-key="86e6be7f94a34a9e9d56fc351949f483:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="de67af09b36a404fac528e70b40c158b"></span>

<span key="23d5ed0fe84b4f2ab14b956329f6d59d"><span offset-key="23d5ed0fe84b4f2ab14b956329f6d59d:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="2d5a16f4f9c44b929a08b466e214e7f8"><span offset-key="2d5a16f4f9c44b929a08b466e214e7f8:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://mindorks.com/android-app-development-online-course" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="68a0044fd863416c8018c05e2e5186a8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="43c13f6cf82448d7bc47144a6f9c9ee0"><span data-offset-key="43c13f6cf82448d7bc47144a6f9c9ee0:0">CHECK NOW</span></span></span></a><span key="2c197de1aeab4c8b86f6674ad4b8ec59"><span offset-key="2c197de1aeab4c8b86f6674ad4b8ec59:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="ed2960a8bcd14a7b8353226c56944b6c">**4. Using a Hash Table**</span>

<span key="0502a2c3c46a4a50997333400624b43c"><span offset-key="0502a2c3c46a4a50997333400624b43c:0">Idea is to use the Hash Table to improve the time complexity because it performs searching and insertion efficiently in O(1) average.</span></span>

> <span key="98984b3d2321405389dce22cccf4b591">**Solution Steps**</span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="6e20e55731aa475d9928cf8d35c483e7"><span offset-key="6e20e55731aa475d9928cf8d35c483e7:0">Take a Hash Table H of size O(n)</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="3b127b04a4a04708844a11ad895aa723"><span offset-key="3b127b04a4a04708844a11ad895aa723:0">Run a loop and scan over the array A\[\] for each A\[i\]. Check if K-A\[i\] is present in the hash table or not.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="725c85da360e4f72a3acfa2798f786e0"><span offset-key="725c85da360e4f72a3acfa2798f786e0:0">If yes, we have found the pair and return true.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9b0d1d47ff27416b8a85341b93d20065"><span offset-key="9b0d1d47ff27416b8a85341b93d20065:0">If no, then insert A\[i\] into the Hash table</span></span>

<span key="7fbe3ff2a7c04a5d8846bd1cba729c6a"><span offset-key="7fbe3ff2a7c04a5d8846bd1cba729c6a:0">3. If you didn’t find such a pair by end of the loop then return false.</span></span>

> <span key="4341c7cd099b4a6fa41d4bb812341f7c">**Pseudo Code**</span>

1

<span key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a"><span offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:0">bool </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:1">checkPair</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:2">(</span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:3">int</span><span offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:4"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:5">A</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:6">\[\],</span><span offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:7"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:8">int</span><span offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:9"> n</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:10">,</span><span offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:11"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:12">int</span><span offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:13"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:14">K</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:15">)</span><span offset-key="35157672e279462f9fd4ca84cf0d389a:16"> </span></span>

2

<span key="4c9490f599fd45759c527cbffba0a419"><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="4c9490f599fd45759c527cbffba0a419:0">{</span><span offset-key="4c9490f599fd45759c527cbffba0a419:1"> </span></span>

3

<span key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434"><span offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:0"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:1">Take</span><span offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:2"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:3">Hash</span><span offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:4"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:5">Table</span><span offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:6"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:7">H</span><span offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:8"> of size </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:9">O</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:10">(</span><span offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:11">n</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a9cfe719e48445879858d07090cc1434:12">)</span></span>

4

<span key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92"><span offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:0"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:1">for</span><span offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:2"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:3">(</span><span offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:4">i </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:5">=</span><span offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:6"> </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:7">0</span><span offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:8"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:9">to</span><span offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:10"> </span><span class="r-17tb59b" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:11">n</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:12">-</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:13">1</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3c284114f7214ab2bc63f16024638a92:14">)</span></span>

<span key="c20f1967cc264acb9c7d1d4e4804ebe8"><span offset-key="c20f1967cc264acb9c7d1d4e4804ebe8:0"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c20f1967cc264acb9c7d1d4e4804ebe8:1">{</span><span offset-key="c20f1967cc264acb9c7d1d4e4804ebe8:2"> </span></span>

<span key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c"><span offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:0"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:1">int</span><span offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:2"> x </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:3">=</span><span offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:4"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:5">K</span><span offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:6"> </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:7">-</span><span offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:8"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:9">A</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:10">\[</span><span offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:11">i</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="965641b956e843b88e173049f587604c:12">\]</span></span>

<span key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5"><span offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:0"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:1">if</span><span offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:2"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:3">(</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:4">H</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:5">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:6">search</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:7">(</span><span offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:8">x</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:9">)</span><span offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:10"> is </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:11">true</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:12">)</span><span offset-key="8696f9ed6b504e6ca8643d0884d385f5:13"> </span></span>

<span key="c1253accc3384838a02a4d4b4b201da3"><span offset-key="c1253accc3384838a02a4d4b4b201da3:0"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c1253accc3384838a02a4d4b4b201da3:1">return</span><span offset-key="c1253accc3384838a02a4d4b4b201da3:2"> </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="c1253accc3384838a02a4d4b4b201da3:3">1</span></span>

<span key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531"><span offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:0"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:1">H</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:2">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:3">insert</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:4">(</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:5">A</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:6">\[</span><span offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:7">i</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:8">\])</span><span offset-key="ae8c29e2034d4446a8f9bc0a5f752531:9"> </span></span>

<span key="fd8d9d5c6cc540cbbf14baef8f6ae098"><span offset-key="fd8d9d5c6cc540cbbf14baef8f6ae098:0"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fd8d9d5c6cc540cbbf14baef8f6ae098:1">return</span><span offset-key="fd8d9d5c6cc540cbbf14baef8f6ae098:2"> </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fd8d9d5c6cc540cbbf14baef8f6ae098:3">-</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fd8d9d5c6cc540cbbf14baef8f6ae098:4">1</span></span>

> <span key="3ecaf83d4a944ca4ae5d6916b02401e8">**Complexity Analysis**</span>

<span key="5b78e4ebbed84d64b21d118b61cf0b18"><span offset-key="5b78e4ebbed84d64b21d118b61cf0b18:0">In worst case scenario, we scan the whole array and didn't find any such pair. Time Complexity = Time complexity of inserting n elements in hash table + Time complexity of searching (K-A\[i\]) n times in hash table = n. O(1) + n . O(1) = O(n)</span></span>

<span key="f82079fff4124e47a8973741e2af9c68"><span offset-key="f82079fff4124e47a8973741e2af9c68:0">Space Complexity = Extra space of Hash Table = O(n)</span></span>

6.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">6.</span>
    <span key="9ba068afe1614d3793c0231b7ffe2bdf"><span offset-key="9ba068afe1614d3793c0231b7ffe2bdf:0">Given two integer array A\[\] and B\[\] of size m and n(n &lt;= m) respectively. We have to check whether B\[\] is a subset of A\[\] or not.</span></span>

# 

<span key="7aa73453fdf64c1da3a8af6091e9fec9"><span offset-key="7aa73453fdf64c1da3a8af6091e9fec9:0">Find a pair with the given sum in an array</span></span>

<span key="eb3220fdc05543e3b5821021d2dac07b"><span offset-key="eb3220fdc05543e3b5821021d2dac07b:0">Given an unsorted integer array, find a pair with the given sum in it.</span></span>

<span key="a2f88268f9e4438a9270a53af60b018d"><span offset-key="a2f88268f9e4438a9270a53af60b018d:0">For example,</span></span>

<span key="8f108adef5224c898ca850885fe4ab40">**Input:**<span offset-key="8f108adef5224c898ca850885fe4ab40:1"> arr = \[8, 7, 2, 5, 3, 1\] target = 10 </span>**Output:**<span offset-key="8f108adef5224c898ca850885fe4ab40:3"> Pair found (8, 2) or Pair found (7, 3) </span>**Input:**<span offset-key="8f108adef5224c898ca850885fe4ab40:5"> arr = \[5, 2, 6, 8, 1, 9\] target = 12 </span>**Output:**<span offset-key="8f108adef5224c898ca850885fe4ab40:7"> Pair not found</span></span>

> <span key="5debb37cc0e34b66a04365e1449b23cc"><span offset-key="5debb37cc0e34b66a04365e1449b23cc:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://techiedelight.com/practice/?problem=TwoSum" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="38a5ad663d0c43cd80f9c0309fa13e86" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="d3f9d93dd31242719c2d4412864dce97"><span data-offset-key="d3f9d93dd31242719c2d4412864dce97:0">Practice this problem</span></span></span></a><span key="219e32992230405e98544b146f7506f7"><span offset-key="219e32992230405e98544b146f7506f7:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="95ac32cda11346718f41f57b2e014a12"><span offset-key="95ac32cda11346718f41f57b2e014a12:0">There are several methods to solve this problem using brute-force, sorting, and hashing. These are discussed below:</span></span>

## 

<span key="187741d555cd41f3a6543a1974e7766d"><span offset-key="187741d555cd41f3a6543a1974e7766d:0">1. Using Brute-Force</span></span>

<span key="3074e3a2bdff46978583a8a995f44d1d"><span offset-key="3074e3a2bdff46978583a8a995f44d1d:0">A naive solution is to consider every pair in the given array and return if the desired sum is found. This approach is demonstrated below in C, Java, and Python:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="63b8f6c5bfac4be9aed4eec2f077c1ed"><span offset-key="63b8f6c5bfac4be9aed4eec2f077c1ed:0">C</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="bb3b2ccbd2ad443aa05035ad19ff7c2d"><span offset-key="bb3b2ccbd2ad443aa05035ad19ff7c2d:0">Java</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ea2b525515264c168f21389a47624363"><span offset-key="ea2b525515264c168f21389a47624363:0">Python</span></span>

<span key="29c076aa14054ddd81c1f46afb49ac1e"><span offset-key="29c076aa14054ddd81c1f46afb49ac1e:0"> </span></span>

<span key="14ad6a27035f4a63a4e96224cfceb339"><span offset-key="14ad6a27035f4a63a4e96224cfceb339:0">12345678910111213141516171819202122232425</span></span>

<span key="736047ef42ad4de4b035465edf8b0872"><span offset-key="736047ef42ad4de4b035465edf8b0872:0"># Naive method to find a pair in a list with the given sumdef findPair(A, target): # consider each element except the last for i in range(len(A) - 1): # start from the i'th element until the last element for j in range(i + 1, len(A)): # if the desired sum is found, print it if A\[i\] + A\[j\] == target: print("Pair found", (A\[i\], A\[j\])) return # No pair with the given sum exists in the list print("Pair not found") if \_\_name\_\_ == '\_\_main\_\_': A = \[8, 7, 2, 5, 3, 1\] target = 10 findPair(A, target) </span></span>

<span key="3ccec7be3cd043a3be611b46908fa16f"><span offset-key="3ccec7be3cd043a3be611b46908fa16f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.techiedelight.com/code/vfgXZzP" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="01e296e0887c4c2dbd321fc402f99eb3" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="0c286e361a674a3596054e23dc2b0e6f"><span data-offset-key="0c286e361a674a3596054e23dc2b0e6f:0">Download</span></span></span></a><span key="096ce5a727df44ed9cad99872ca15af7"><span offset-key="096ce5a727df44ed9cad99872ca15af7:0"> </span></span><a href="https://techiedelight.com/compiler/?run=vfgXZzP" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f07359238cef4df2a25ad749ddaff117" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="511b54fc88244dd795ce0cce13ca64c1"><span data-offset-key="511b54fc88244dd795ce0cce13ca64c1:0">Run Code</span></span></span></a><span key="511714efce23438785aa34312d689e76"><span offset-key="511714efce23438785aa34312d689e76:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="af51eed2ce424c698cb0f2ea7fe19d53">**Output:**<span offset-key="af51eed2ce424c698cb0f2ea7fe19d53:1"> Pair found (8, 2) </span></span>

<span key="42a5276e1b6d4f59bcfda2664e89fdc3"><span offset-key="42a5276e1b6d4f59bcfda2664e89fdc3:0">The time complexity of the above solution is O(n2) and doesn’t require any extra space, where </span>`n`<span offset-key="42a5276e1b6d4f59bcfda2664e89fdc3:2"> is the size of the input.</span></span>

## 

<span key="02ef5adeb43a4abc8ddccd458dde28d6"><span offset-key="02ef5adeb43a4abc8ddccd458dde28d6:0">2. Using Sorting</span></span>

<span key="6827cff996ce4252b2e7c76f6e69165f"><span offset-key="6827cff996ce4252b2e7c76f6e69165f:0">The idea is to </span></span><a href="https://www.techiedelight.com/sort-array-ascending-order-cpp/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="46bf347b35444fe797ef02bc1d22c322" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="1f30c43891ff4a5fa45e0868942cc45a"><span data-offset-key="1f30c43891ff4a5fa45e0868942cc45a:0">sort the given array</span></span></span></a><span key="c5c731c66a6540708d13c73227509a8c"><span offset-key="c5c731c66a6540708d13c73227509a8c:0"> in ascending order and maintain search space by maintaining two indices (</span>`low`<span offset-key="c5c731c66a6540708d13c73227509a8c:2"> and </span>`high`<span offset-key="c5c731c66a6540708d13c73227509a8c:4">) that initially points to two endpoints of the array. Then reduce the search space </span>`arr[low…high]`<span offset-key="c5c731c66a6540708d13c73227509a8c:6"> at each iteration of the loop by comparing the sum of elements present at indices </span>`low`<span offset-key="c5c731c66a6540708d13c73227509a8c:8"> and </span>`high`<span offset-key="c5c731c66a6540708d13c73227509a8c:10"> with the desired sum. Increment </span>`low`<span offset-key="c5c731c66a6540708d13c73227509a8c:12"> if the sum is less than the expected sum; otherwise, decrement </span>`high`<span offset-key="c5c731c66a6540708d13c73227509a8c:14"> if the sum is more than the desired sum. If the pair is found, return it.</span></span>

<span key="78533e9aac294a828a8e511098a6efa8"><span offset-key="78533e9aac294a828a8e511098a6efa8:0">Following is the C++, Java, and Python implementation based on the idea:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a64f6661ba814917a41820fb40b9340b"><span offset-key="a64f6661ba814917a41820fb40b9340b:0">C++</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1f06372ce57e473ebd88b93d89a3267e"><span offset-key="1f06372ce57e473ebd88b93d89a3267e:0">Java</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c1b62f6c38214dd99e3eee2c1a1449be"><span offset-key="c1b62f6c38214dd99e3eee2c1a1449be:0">Python</span></span>

<span key="056b90552ff647e7893e14b7c79d4556"><span offset-key="056b90552ff647e7893e14b7c79d4556:0"> </span></span>

<span key="30ff1443ba7e4565b948f5c402762755"><span offset-key="30ff1443ba7e4565b948f5c402762755:0">123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536</span></span>

<span key="cbeb1e8e4d0b4d078ee13756cb3453f0"><span offset-key="cbeb1e8e4d0b4d078ee13756cb3453f0:0"># Function to find a pair in an array with a given sum using sortingdef findPair(A, target): # sort the list in ascending order A.sort() # maintain two indices pointing to endpoints of the list (low, high) = (0, len(A) - 1) # reduce the search space \`A\[low…high\]\` at each iteration of the loop # loop till the search space is exhausted while low &lt; high: if A\[low\] + A\[high\] == target: # target found print("Pair found", (A\[low\], A\[high\])) return # increment \`low\` index if the total is less than the desired sum; # decrement \`high\` index if the total is more than the desired sum if A\[low\] + A\[high\] &lt; target: low = low + 1 else: high = high - 1 # No pair with the given sum exists print("Pair not found") if \_\_name\_\_ == '\_\_main\_\_': A = \[8, 7, 2, 5, 3, 1\] target = 10 findPair(A, target) </span></span>

<span key="b5aecc3afde6483cb6ad447be6941e55"><span offset-key="b5aecc3afde6483cb6ad447be6941e55:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.techiedelight.com/code/BuxbMfP" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="030bec0001a1470ead918d976d98523a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="f1fb0e7ccbdb496d902da9bcf012ebc8"><span data-offset-key="f1fb0e7ccbdb496d902da9bcf012ebc8:0">Download</span></span></span></a><span key="879f107c81ae4c568c533d6498c6d12b"><span offset-key="879f107c81ae4c568c533d6498c6d12b:0"> </span></span><a href="https://techiedelight.com/compiler/?run=BuxbMfP" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2f3da09d419944f383e3a3ac5544b697" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="f70216cb718d4b6dab737d56dce5f758"><span data-offset-key="f70216cb718d4b6dab737d56dce5f758:0">Run Code</span></span></span></a><span key="68598638d79d4333a162c6992ba55c99"><span offset-key="68598638d79d4333a162c6992ba55c99:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="ec750cfa90844bd09555b17ef56144bf">**Output:**<span offset-key="ec750cfa90844bd09555b17ef56144bf:1"> Pair found (2, 8) </span></span>

<span key="1ce74f4dfdaf4c7b8534b23f59e94e26"><span offset-key="1ce74f4dfdaf4c7b8534b23f59e94e26:0">The time complexity of the above solution is O(n.log(n)) and doesn’t require any extra space.</span></span>

## 

<span key="104c80e1455044998f48a35cd8f66899"><span offset-key="104c80e1455044998f48a35cd8f66899:0">3. Using Hashing</span></span>

<span key="3001b4448f90406f8429b83290e73401"><span offset-key="3001b4448f90406f8429b83290e73401:0">We can use a </span></span><a href="https://www.techiedelight.com/hashing-in-data-structure/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b66760aeb2cb406dbfecd8c63f63b4c8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="bec9d7aa98984ddabd9ab6f343275775"><span data-offset-key="bec9d7aa98984ddabd9ab6f343275775:0">hash table</span></span></span></a><span key="c8687111de8a49309e592d87a914f988"><span offset-key="c8687111de8a49309e592d87a914f988:0"> to solve this problem in linear time. The idea is to insert each array element </span>`arr[i]`<span offset-key="c8687111de8a49309e592d87a914f988:2"> into a map. We also check if difference </span>`(arr[i], target - arr[i])`<span offset-key="c8687111de8a49309e592d87a914f988:4"> already exists in the map or not. If the difference is seen before, print the pair and return. The algorithm can be implemented as follows in C++, Java, and Python:</span></span>

    <span key="c59b9f2452864075af0da3be3e87f8e5"><span offset-key="c59b9f2452864075af0da3be3e87f8e5:0">C++</span></span>

    <span key="ec1540f22174453e8560975a121d3258"><span offset-key="ec1540f22174453e8560975a121d3258:0">Java</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="dcdc632a65304afbb603fc20a33baedb"><span offset-key="dcdc632a65304afbb603fc20a33baedb:0">Python</span></span>

<span key="afcbf1f8e66146308a059d20416eff6a"><span offset-key="afcbf1f8e66146308a059d20416eff6a:0"> </span></span>

<span key="495ca68f6121451b82296ed35b849eda"><span offset-key="495ca68f6121451b82296ed35b849eda:0">123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930</span></span>

<span key="81bd42d8bc3f426981a901145a4abc49"><span offset-key="81bd42d8bc3f426981a901145a4abc49:0"># Function to find a pair in an array with a given sum using hashingdef findPair(A, target): # create an empty dictionary dict = {} # do for each element for i, e in enumerate(A): # check if pair \`(e, target - e)\` exists # if the difference is seen before, print the pair if target - e in dict: print("Pair found", (A\[dict.get(target - e)\], A\[i\])) return # store index of the current element in the dictionary dict\[e\] = i # No pair with the given sum exists in the list print("Pair not found") if \_\_name\_\_ == '\_\_main\_\_': A = \[8, 7, 2, 5, 3, 1\] target = 10 findPair(A, target) </span></span>

<span key="2e6d400e7fe74e0990ea0cd7f418911c"><span offset-key="2e6d400e7fe74e0990ea0cd7f418911c:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.techiedelight.com/code/D73rFKP" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c9cca949ca2a44329e52ec730e74f4f6" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="3fd4cefbeee84890a4c0b6c90b2073e0"><span data-offset-key="3fd4cefbeee84890a4c0b6c90b2073e0:0">Download</span></span></span></a><span key="842ff842752b473696f088e8e6a089dc"><span offset-key="842ff842752b473696f088e8e6a089dc:0"> </span></span><a href="https://techiedelight.com/compiler/?run=D73rFKP" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="90eca297a912449c9bd9becf3e7c1809" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-36906_259-36907-237__"><span data-key="1909c3d26904412092f4c0f2a9f50aea"><span data-offset-key="1909c3d26904412092f4c0f2a9f50aea:0">Run Code</span></span></span></a><span key="80be01e002af42c39c0b41b195581f86"><span offset-key="80be01e002af42c39c0b41b195581f86:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="33353ee2aa704bd1bdc28cdb6638f68a">**Output:**<span offset-key="33353ee2aa704bd1bdc28cdb6638f68a:1"> Pair found (8, 2)</span></span>

<span key="49da7c0606b048abb3e7872351f61397"><span offset-key="49da7c0606b048abb3e7872351f61397:0">A </span>**simple solution**<span offset-key="49da7c0606b048abb3e7872351f61397:2"> is to traverse each element and check if there’s another number in the array which can be added to it to give sum.</span></span>

<span key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d">`<script>`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:1"> </span>`// JavaScript implementation of simple method to// find print pairs with given sum.`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:3"> </span>`// Returns number of pairs in arr[0..n-1]// with sum equal to 'sum'function`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:5"> </span>`printPairs(arr, n, sum){    let count = 0; // Initialize result`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:7"> </span>`    // Consider all possible pairs and check    // their sums    for`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:9"> </span>`(let i = 0; i < n; i++)        for`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:11"> </span>`(let j = i + 1; j < n; j++)            if`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:13"> </span>`(arr[i] + arr[j] == sum)                 document.write("("`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:15"> </span>`+ arr[i] + ", "                    + arr[j] + ")"`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:17"> </span>`+ "<br>");}`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:19"> </span>`// Driver function to test the above function`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:21"> </span>`    let arr = [ 1, 5, 7, -1, 5 ];    let n = arr.length;    let sum = 6;    printPairs(arr, n, sum);`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:23"> </span>`// This code is contributed by Surbhi Tyagi`<span offset-key="5d5141236ce84282a397aaefaad9007d:25"> </span>`</script>`</span>

1

<span key="dd9cf1d33a8146ce91fe5494a15e993a"><span offset-key="dd9cf1d33a8146ce91fe5494a15e993a:0">(1, 5)</span></span>

2

<span key="efa1aef371b54d77b1440da593d6f4b5"><span offset-key="efa1aef371b54d77b1440da593d6f4b5:0">(1, 5)</span></span>

<span key="eccf07c81f894d5c948ce94d0e5bdeee"><span offset-key="eccf07c81f894d5c948ce94d0e5bdeee:0"> </span></span>

<span key="cf889b9af9da48139e8a89676af57a70">**Method 2 (Use hashing)**<span offset-key="cf889b9af9da48139e8a89676af57a70:1">. We create an empty hash table. Now we traverse through the array and check for pairs in the hash table. If a matching element is found, we print the pair number of times equal to the number of occurrences of the matching element. Note that the worst case of time complexity of this solution is </span>**O(c + n)**<span offset-key="cf889b9af9da48139e8a89676af57a70:3"> where c is the count of pairs with a given sum.</span></span>

    <span key="9ad4323a593d4f4a8906e4d56c16dfd2"><span offset-key="9ad4323a593d4f4a8906e4d56c16dfd2:0">Javascript</span></span>

<span key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5">`<script>      // JavaScript implementation of simple method to      // find count of pairs with given sum.      // Returns number of pairs in arr[0..n-1]      // with sum equal to 'sum'      function`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:1"> </span>`printPairs(arr, n, sum) {        // Store counts of all elements in map m        var`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:3"> </span>`m = {};`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:5"> </span>`        // Traverse through all elements        for`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:7"> </span>`(var`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:9"> </span>`i = 0;            }          }`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:31"> </span>`          if`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:33"> </span>`(m.hasOwnProperty(arr[i])) {            m[arr[i]]++;          } else`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:35"> </span>`{            m[arr[i]] = 1;          }        }      }`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:37"> </span>`      // Driver code      var`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:39"> </span>`arr = [1, 5, 7, -1, 5];      var`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:41"> </span>`n = arr.length;      var`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:43"> </span>`sum = 6;`<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:45"> </span>`      printPairs(arr, n, sum);      `<span offset-key="dcd3d50a0ed74a54808f610cc7093df5:47"> </span>`      // This code is contributed by rdtank.    </script>`</span>

<a href="interview.html#find-all-the-pairs-of-two-integers-in-an-unsorted-array-that-sum-up-to-a-given-s." class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

Find all the pairs of two integers in an unsorted array that sum up to a given S.

<a href="interview.html#for-example-if-the-array-is-3-5-2-4-8-11-and-the-sum-is-7-your-program-should-return-11-4-2-5" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

For example, if the array is \[3, 5, 2, -4, 8, 11\] and the sum is 7, your program should return \[\[11, -4\], \[2, 5\]\]

<a href="interview.html#because-11-+-4-7-and-2-+-5-7." class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

because 11 + -4 = 7 and 2 + 5 = 7.

<a href="interview.html#array-3-5-2-4-8-11" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

array = \[3, 5, 2, -4, 8, 11\]

<a href="interview.html#find-a-pair-with-the-given-sum-in-an-array" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

Find a pair with the given sum in an array

2\. Using Sorting

<a href="interview.html#hashing" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

3\. Using Hashing
